physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a street scene of two shops. The shop signs are written in chinese. In the foreground, there is a woman carrying baskets on a carrying pole on her shoulder. On the right of the photograph, there is a man on a bicycle. There are several puddles of water on the floor. The photograph is slightlyt blurry. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of street scene
subject_terms_1: street scenes ways of life stores snapshots
